sectiondef.header: Virtual methods that are triggered when necessary but they do nothing in

description.para: the View class.
They can be overridden when necessary in the child classses.

sectiondef.header: Navigation methods for changing the page in the view.

description.para: Navigating will check that the page exists in the document and also set it by calling SetPage (with doLayout = true);

sectiondef.header: Methods for converting coordinates from the logical world to the device

description.para: context world.
X coordinates are identical in both worlds. Y coordinates are from bottom to top in the logical world and from top to bottom in the device context world.

sectiondef.header: Methods for calculating drawing positions

description.para: Defined in view_element.cpp

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing System, ScoreDef, StaffDef, Staff, and Layer.

description.para: Additional methods for drawing braces, barlines, slurs, etc.

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing RunningElements (PgHead, PgFoot, etc.)

description.para: Defined in view_running.cpp

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing children

description.para: Defined in view_page.cpp For each method, we have a parent Object, that can be either the same as the next paremeter, or an intermediate node in the hierarchy.
For example, we can draw the system children from the system itself (in that case, parent will be the same as system) or from an editorial element occuring in between.

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing EditorialElement object at different levels

description.para: Defined in view_page.cpp

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing Annotations

description.para: Defined in view_page.cpp

sectiondef.header: Top level method for drawing LayerElement.

description.para: This can be called recursively for elements containing other elements.
This the case for Note, Beam, Tuplet, Chords, etc. Defined in view_element.cpp

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing LayerElement child classes.

description.para: They are base drawing methods that are called directly from DrawLayerElement Because some elements draw their children recursively (e.g., Note) they must all have the same parameters Defined in view_element.cpp

sectiondef.header: Methods for drawing parts of LayerElement child classes.

description.para: They are sub-drawing methods that are called from the base drawing methods above.
The parameter set can be different from a base drawing method since no recursive call is expected. Defined in view_element.cpp

memberdef.argsstring: (DeviceContext *dc, int x, int y, unsigned char dots, Staff *staff)

memberdef.name: DrawMeterSigFigures

memberdef.name: DrawMRptPart

briefdescription.para: Internal method for drawing a BeamSegment.

sectiondef.header: The objects currently selected.

description.para: To be used in child classes, but defined here because it can be useful for changing the color, for example

briefdescription.para: Values to adjust tie/slur thickness by to have proper MEI values for thickness.

sectiondef.header: Internal values for storing temporary values for ligatures

briefdescription.para: The colour currently being used when drawing.

detaileddescription.para: It can change when drawing the m_currentElement, for example
The is set when starting to draw a page in DrawCurrentPage and then modified appropriately when going through the page.

briefdescription.para: Simply returns the value of the last note-type element (mensural or neume)
Set the document the view is pointing to (mandatory).

detaileddescription.para: Several views can point to the same document.

briefdescription.para: Set the current page to pageIdx.

detaileddescription.para: If doLayout is true, the layout of the page will be calculated. This is the default behavior, however, in some cases, we do not want it. For example, when drawing the pages for getting the bounding boxes.

briefdescription.para: Method that actually draw the current page.

detaileddescription.para: This is the only drawing method that is public and that can be called for drawing. The method also takes care of setting the drawing page of the document by calling Doc::SetDrawingPage. It means that we have different views, each view can have a different current page and it will still work properly. Defined in view_page.cpp

briefdescription.para: Return the pixel per unit factor of the current page (if any, 1.0 otherwise)
Calculate the ScoreDef width by taking into account its widest key signature.

detaileddescription.para: This is used in justifiation for anticipating the width of initial scoreDefs that are not drawn in the un-casted system.

briefdescription.para: This class is a drawing context and corresponds to the view of a MVC design pattern.
